clinical_study.brief_title: Support for Perinatal Adherence and Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Project INSPireD: Integrating Nuanced Support for Perinatal Adherence and Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The main aim is to conduct a pilot field test of a group-based depression and adherence counseling intervention with HIV-infected women in the perinatal period. Participants will be HIV-infected women living in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

detailed_description.textblock: The main aim of this study is to conduct a pilot field test of a group-based counseling intervention with HIV-infected women in the perinatal period as delivered by a lay counselor. The primary goal of the intervention is to reduce symptoms of perinatal depression and increase adherence to antiretroviral therapy among HIV-infected women during pregnancy and the postpartum period.

primary_outcome.description: The primary goal is to increase adherence to antiretroviral therapy among HIV-infected women during pregnancy and the postpartum period. The investigators will examine this outcome post intervention and at three months post delivery.

primary_outcome.measure: Number participants who report depressive symptoms as measured by EPDS and MINI.
primary_outcome.description: The primary goal is to reduce symptoms of perinatal depression among HIV-infected women. The investigators will examine this outcome post intervention and at three months post delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number participants who report stigma as measured by the HIV/AIDS Stigma Instrument.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will examine reductions in stigma post treatment and 3 months after delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of social support as measured by the Duke-UNC Functional Social Support Questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.description: Increased social support. The investigators will examine this outcome post intervention and at three months post delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence to other aspects of the postpartum PMTCT cascade

arm_group.description: This 5-8 session group intervention, "Integrating Nuanced Support for Perinatal adherence and Depression", aims to decrease depressive symptoms and improve antiretroviral adherence among HIV-infected pregnant and postpartum women. Intervention content is based on two established cognitive-behavioral interventions: problem-solving therapy and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Adherence and Depression.

The Wait-list control group will be referred to standard of care counseling services, and will start the intervention upon completion of the first experimental group. They will receive the intervention with the next experimental group cycle.

intervention.intervention_name: Integrating Nuanced Support for Perinatal adherence and Depression
intervention.description: A 5-8 session intervention to decrease depressive symptoms and improve antiretroviral adherence among HIV-infected pregnant and postpartum women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Currently pregnant
- HIV-infected and diagnosed with HIV during the index pregnancy
- Meet criteria for a major depressive episode
- Currently on antiretroviral therapy
- Receiving antenatal care at PMMH Gateway clinic
- Primary language English or isiZulu
- Access to a phone and willing to give researchers permission to reach them via phone
- Resident of Umlazi
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent
- Active untreated, major mental illness (untreated psychosis, bipolar disorder, dementia, or active suicidality) that would interfere with study participation
- Less than 18 years of age
